body: Have you tried wrapping a string with `\yii\db\Expression`?

This?

``` php
$query->orderBy(new \yii\db\Expression('CASE WHEN x = y THEN 0 ELSE 1 END'));
```

 It doesn't work. The final guilty is [guy](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/db/QueryBuilder.php#L808).
Right. It works with columns only now...

It should work when using array syntax: `$query->orderBy(['CASE WHEN x = y THEN 0 ELSE 1 END' => SORT_ASC]);`

But we may allow expression too.
Yes, a test would not hurt.

issue.title: 10535 -  \yii\db\Expression with complex expression (aggregate functions and etc) for Order By clause

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.title: DB Expressions in groupBy and orderBy

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Following #10535 there is now inconsistency between what argument types are accepted for groupBy and orderBy.
- [x] added tests to verify adding parameters works in SELECT, GROUP BY, ORDER BY
- [x] Fix GROUP BY to accept expressions in QueryBuilder
- [x] Fix GROUP BY and ORDER BY to accept expressions that include parameters. 

fixes #8824, fixes #10647
